results.title: Don Giovanni
results.creator_credit: Dave Heather and Southern Television Corporation Pty Limited
results.brief_description: Glyndebourne Festival Opera, along with the London Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Bernard haitink and the Glyndebourne Chorus directed by Nicholas Cleobury, presents Don Giovanni by W.A. Mozart with libretto by Lorenzo Da Ponte. This original production is by Sir Peter Hall, Director of the National Theatre, and features Benjamin Luxon in the lead role of Don Giovanni, Stafford Dean (Leporello), Rachel Yakar (Donna Elvira), Horiana Branisteanu (Donna Anna), Leo Goeke (Don Ottavio), Elizabeth Gale (Zerlina), John Rawnsley (Masetto) and Pierre Thau (Commendatore). Sung in Italian with English subtitles. Includes program notes.

results.title: Don Giovanni
results.creator_credit: Peter Butler, ABC-TV (Australia) and Opera Australia
results.brief_description: Sung in Italian with English subtitles, this opera combines comedy and tragedy to produce the story of Don Giovanni. The central character of Giovanni is the anti-hero, a brilliant, irresponsible villain, an amourous libertine who receives his comeupances by refusing to repent. Performers on the tape include Lisa Gasteen, Gilli Sullivan, Fiona Janes and David Hobson. The performance was part of an Esso night at the opera,recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, January 1991 and was directed by Lindy Hume. Featuring the Australian Opera and Ballet Orchestra, conducted by Gyorgy Fischer, this performance was based on the production by Goran Jarvefelt.

results.title: Don Carlo
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Clemente D'Alessio and Metropolitan Opera (New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: This wonderful and lavish production of Don Carlo by Giuseppe Verdi was recorded live at the Metropolitan Opera on 26 March 1983 and performed by an extraordinary cast including Placido Domingo in the role of Don Carlo, with Mirella Freni (Elizabeth of Valois), Grace Bumbry (The Princess Eboli), Louis Quilico (Rodrigo), Nicolai Ghiaurov (King Philip) and Ferruccio Furlanetto (The Grand Inquisitor). Production by John Dexter and featuring the Metropolitan Opera Orchestra conducted by James Levine and the Metropolitan Opera Chorus lead by chorus master David Stivender. Also included on this tape is a special short program “Verdi at San’t Agata” about Verdi’s beautiful villa which is now preserved just as he left it. Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Don Carlo
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Covent Garden Video Productions and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Opera is arguably the best medium for dramatising history and this is particularly true for Verdi’s “Don Carlo” in Luchino Visconti’s magnificent and definitive 1958 production. Set in France and Spain in the second half of the 16th century, the five act opera tells of the political and amorous rivalry between Philip II of Spain and his son, Don Carlo. Bernard Haitink conducts The Orchestra of the Royal Opera House and a superb cast is led by Ileana Cotrubas as a tender and touching Elisabetta accompanied by the fine lyric tenor Luis Lima in the title role. Sung in Italian and English.

results.title: Don Breaks Out
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A profile of an enthusiast - a man whose fascination with the motion picture is equalled only by his fondness for creating instruments to make music. Maritimer Don Fletcher, ex-prison guard, now film projectionist, explains to an audience of university students how he came to make films, and also demonstrates how he built a violin unlike any other, which nevertheless pours out the real down-east country sound.

results.title: Don't stand so close to me
results.brief_description: On the threshold of year 12 Morgan Preston seems to have everything under control. She has a best friend, is familiar with the teachers, and is keeping on top of the ever increasing amount of homework. Morgan’s stability is threatened with the arrival of a new history teacher, Jack Hamilton. Jack and Morgan develop an unusual relationship that challenges the boundaries of conformity and forces both of them into a moral dilemma. Cast includes Alison Gordon, Luke Dean, Georgina McClure and Maureen Sherlock.

results.title: Don't move = Non ti muovere
results.creator_credit: Sergio Castellitto, Riccardo Tozzi, Giovanni Stabilini, Marco Chimenz, Medusa Film and Cattleya
results.brief_description: As his teenage daughter’s life hangs in the balance, a surgeon recalls crucial moments of his life, including an angst-ridden affair with a marginalised Albanian woman (a seriously de-glamorised Penelope Cruz) who he raped, but subsequently became sexually and emotionally entangled with. Adapted from the best-selling novel by Margaret Mazzantini, Castellitto (who also wrote the screenplay and previously directed the charming drama “Mostly Martha”) presents an unflattering view of male anguish, betrayal and brutality as Timoteo becomes conflicted by his double life as an urbane husband on the one hand and a violent lover to a troubled waif, living in abject conditions, on the other.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sergio Castellitto, Riccardo Tozzi, Giovanni Stabilini, Marco Chimenz, Medusa Film and Cattleya

results.title: Don't knock the ox
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The International Ox Pull, highlight of the Bridgewater, Nova Scotia, annual fair, is a holdover from the pioneer past when oxen cleared the land and tilled the soil. That these great beasts of burden have lost none of their pulling power is well demonstrated as they drag tons of weight loaded on sleds (the winner pulls up to six tons). Competing teams come from various parts of the Maritimes and the northeastern United States.

results.title: Don't eat the pictures
results.brief_description: This zany musical follows the adventures of Big Bird, Smiffy, Cookie Monster and the rest of the Sesame Street gang as they find themselves accidentally locked in the Metro Museum overnight. Featuring cameo appearances by James Mason, Fritz Weaver and Paul Dooley.

results.title: Perfect strangers
results.creator_credit: Stephen Poliakoff, John Chapman and BBC
results.brief_description: A drama with family, immigration and belonging the main themes. With a dreamy and slow atmosphere, this family history story unfolds with the use of family photographs as story telling tools. It’s a moving series about relationships and ancestors, history and reunion. Cast includes Michael Gambon and Lindsay Duncan.
